brief_summary.textblock:
This is a retrospective analysis of children (≤21years old) who received clinical treatment
      with either Romiplostim or Eltrombopag at 2 medical centers from 2009-2013.  The children
      included in this study were from Weill Medical College of Cornell University, New York, NY
      and Children's Hospital Orange County, Orange, CA

clinical_study.brief_title: A Retrospective Chart Review of Thirty Three Children Who Have Received Clinical Treatment With Either Romiplostim or Eltrombopag Froom 2009-2013

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        1. All patients in this study had received prior treatments before the start of TPO
        treatment including corticosteroids, IVIG, IV anti-D, and/or Rituximab.

        Exclusion Criteria:

        1. Children who do not have ITP

study_pop.textblock:
Patients eligible for this study included both males and females ≤ 21 years old (actual
        range 19 months - 19 years) with persistent/chronic ITP lasting >6 months and were
        diagnosed according to the clinical practice guidelines from the American Society of
        Hematology.

clinical_study.keyword: ITP,TPO agents, Children, Romiplostin and Eltrombopag
clinical_study.official_title: A Retrospective Chart Review of Thirty Three Children Who Have Received Clinical Treatment With Either Romiplostim or Eltrombopag Froom 2009-2013

other_outcome.measure: Persentage of weeks with platelet counts greater than or = to 50,000 independant of rescue therapy.
other_outcome.time_frame: For Rescue therapy is defined as receiving IVIG increased dose steroids or platelet transfusions .  When given this resulted in exclusion of platelet counts for  2 full weeks after iniciation of rescue therapy ..

overall_official.affiliation: Weill Medical College of Cornell University

primary_outcome.measure: Platelet count greater than or = to 50,000

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: An increase in platelets greater than or = to 20,000 over baseline.

clinical_study.source: Weill Medical College of Cornell University

lead_sponsor.agency: Weill Medical College of Cornell University

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Retrospective
